statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Hill leads Gardner-Webb past Coastal Carolina 82-67
article.headline: Hill leads Gardner-Webb past Coastal Carolina 82-67
article.linkText: Hill leads Gardner-Webb past Coastal Carolina 82-67
article.story: CONWAY, S.C. -- Jerome Hill scored 31 points and grabbed 10 rebounds and Gardner-Webb pulled away in the second half to hand Coastal Carolina its first league loss on Saturday, 82-67. Harold McBride had 18 points and Adonis Burbage added 16 for the Bulldogs (12-7, 4-2 Big South), who hit 11 3-pointers, their third-straight game, and seventh of the season, with double-figure treys. The Chanticleers (14-4, 5-1) had won 14 straight home games and are now 34-10 in the HTC Center. Isaiah Ivey, Burbage and McBride hit 3s in the last 1:14 as Gardner-Webb took a 37-34 lead at the half. The Bulldogs had eight treys in 17 attempts in the first half. McBride's 3 midway through the second half made it 61-51 and Hill's three-point play at 4:20 made it 70-54. Hill, who was 11 of 22 from the field and 9-10 from the line, was one point shy of his career high while surpassing 1,000-career points.
